snippet: New York’s unions are demanding more than $7 billion in retroactive pay to make up for years without regular raises.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio, facing task of negotiating new contracts with city's 152 labor bargaining units, names two veterans of Koch administration's labor battles to strengthen his hand; appoints Robert Linn as director of labor relations and Stanley Brezenoff as unpaid adviser to assist in talks; unions are demanding more than $7 billion in retroactive pay to make up for years without regular raises.

byline.original: By KATE TAYLOR and MATT FLEGENHEIMER

lead_paragraph: New York’s unions are demanding more than $7 billion in retroactive pay to make up for years without regular raises.

headline.main: De Blasio Picks Two Koch Veterans to Help Negotiate City Union Contracts
headline.print_headline: De Blasio Picks Two Koch Veterans to Help Negotiate City Union Contracts
